title: Behavior of a function based on derivative graph

content.question: The graph of <math> <semantics> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGabmOzayaafaaaaa@36EB@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, the derivative of the function f, is shown above. Which of the following statements must be true? I. f has a relative minimum at <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2da9iabgkHiTiaaiodaaaa@39A1@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. II. The graph of f has a point of inflection at <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiabg2da9iabgkHiTiaaikdaaaa@39A0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. III. The graph of f is concave down for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>4</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A71@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

topic.text: 5.8: Sketching Graphs of Functions and Their Derivatives

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
